metadata.synopsis: 9-year-old Eva (Thora Birch) dreams of owning a pet, but her mother (Mimi Rogers) doesn't think she's ready and her father (Christopher McDonald) is allergic to animals. One day, she finds a lost capuchin monkey, names him Dodger and secretly brings him home with her. It turns out that Dodger has been trained as an expert pickpocket that and his evil master, the gypsy Azro (Harvey Keitel), wants him back. It's all Eva can do to keep herself and her mischievous new companion out of trouble.

reviews: Ludicrous monkey caper has loads of potty humor.
Great family fun....Birch is a joy
Above average kids movie. The girl is smart and the monkey is clever. Harvey Keitel's villain is a big surprise.
The team of Thora Birch and Finster the primate makes for light and moderately fun family viewing.
A quirky, bright, PG-rated adventure that's as entertaining as Free Willy. Better, maybe, since monkeys are a lot more charismatic than whales. This is a splendid family film.
